required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study of Choline, Its Metabolites, and Phospholipids in Preterm Infants
clinical_study.official_title: Supply of Term and Preterm Neonates With Choline, Lipids and Vitamines

brief_summary.textblock: To study concentrations of choline, its metabolites, and phospholipids in cord blood and remnants of clinically indicated blood samples

detailed_description.textblock:
To collect cord plasma in preterm and term infants. To collect remnants of clinically indicated blood samples in parturients and hospitalized preterm infants during neonatal intensive care.
To determine concentrations of choline, its metabolites, and phospholipids by mass spectrometry.
To compare cord plasma concentrations with postnatal plasma concentrations.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at times when a clinically indicated blood sample is taken before discharge home from the initial neonatal hospitalization (at a postnatal age of up to 4-5 months at the most in very preterm infants)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at times when a clinically indicated blood sample is taken before discharge home from the initial neonatal hospitalization (at a postnatal age of up to 4-5 months at the most in very preterm infants)

secondary_outcome.measure: Concentrations of molecular species of phosphatidylcholine and phosphatidylethanolamine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at times when a clinically indicated blood sample is taken before discharge home from the initial neonatal hospitalization (at a postnatal age of up to 4-5 months at the most in very preterm infants)

arm_group.description: mother who had given birth within 48 hours of clinically indicated blood sampling

intervention.intervention_name: collection of remnant of clinically indicated blood sample
intervention.description: collection of remnant of clinically indicated blood sample

study_pop.textblock: term and preterm neonates, parturients, non-pregnant females

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- meeting criteria of the 4 cohorts
Exclusion Criteria:
- none pre-defined

reference.citation: Bernhard W, Full A, Arand J, Maas C, Poets CF, Franz AR. Choline supply of preterm infants: assessment of dietary intake and pathophysiological considerations. Eur J Nutr. 2013 Apr;52(3):1269-78. doi: 10.1007/s00394-012-0438-x. Epub 2012 Sep 9.
